MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
ADDENDUM TO ORIGINAL LICENSING STUDY REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB610201023
Licensee Name: Catholic Charities West Michigan
Licensee Address: Suite 3A
360 South Division
Grand Rapids, MI 49503
Licensee Telephone #: (616) 243-9122
Administrator/Licensee Designee: Alisa Otto, Designee
Name of Facility: Catholic Charities West Michigan - Muskegon
Facility Address: #125
1720 Park Street
Muskegon, MI 49441
Facility Telephone #: (231) 726-4735
Capacity:
Program Type: CHILD PLACING AGENCY, PRIVATE
1

II. Purpose of Addendum
Catholic Charities West Michigan – Muskegon CB610201023 is relocating from 1095
Third Street Muskegon, MI 49441-1976 to 1720 Park Street
Muskegon, MI 49441.
III. Methodology
The on-site inspection of the new space was completed on June 29, 2021.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The new office is located at 1720 Park Street Muskegon Mi 49441. This is a two-
story building that sits on the east side of Park Street with parking on the south and
east sides of the building. On the main floor is the lobby entrance with separate
waiting rooms for families and youth. Also on the first floor are several meeting
rooms, visitation rooms (with observation rooms attached), a chapel, a storage
room, a baby pantry (items for babies), therapy rooms, restrooms and the staff café
area. Behind the reception desk is a mail room. There is an elevator leading to the
second floor near the back of the building and access to the second floor is
restricted by locks on the doors. On the second floor is a large staff training room,
and several meeting and visitation rooms. The main area used by the Foster Care,
Licensing and Adoption staff has twenty-six “touch down” workstations and four
cubicles for administration staff. Some of the “touch down” workstations are at a
level that workers can stand rather than sit. On the south wall of this main area are
the offices for the program managers and supervisors. Also, just off this main area
are a “Lactation room” and several enclave rooms. The secondary area has
seventeen “touch down” workstations with two administration cubicles. In both areas
there are lockers for staff to place their personal items. Off this secondary main area
is the file room which is locked and secure with a supply room next to it. In the file
room are two locked file cabinets that contains the CHRI information. Also located in
the file room is the crosscut shredder that the agency purchased last year. Lining
two outer walls in the second space are offices for program managers and
supervisors. The second area houses the family preservation programs. There are
several restrooms on the second level along with drinking fountains. Overall, this is a
new constructed building and in excellent shape. The building is decorated in a
warm and friendly fashion and the visitation rooms are family friendly. This space is
more than appropriate for the workings and providing services for this agency.
2

V. Recommendation
I recommend the new location be approved for the address change of this child
placing agency.
6/29/2021
________________________________________
Paul Fatato Date
Licensing Consultant
June 30, 2021
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
3
